Dialogue.NPCText:
A stooped man with curd-stained robes eyes you warily while rearranging rounds of cheese in mismatched baskets.
"You there—yes, you look like someone who values fine dairy and a faint hint of mystery."

He clutches a cheese wheel like a holy relic.
"I'm Brendyl Wheyfoot, and I’m in dire need of aid. Have you ever met a true Cheese Maker? No? Well then. This may be your destiny."

Option.text: A Cheese Maker? That’s... oddly specific.
What sort of aid are you looking for?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“He was once the Crown’s Royal Curdmaster—Theodor Curdswain. Said to have created a blue-veined wedge so potent it cured lycanthropy. But after Lord British vanished, Theodor disappeared too.”
Brendyl sighs, eyes watering.
“Last I heard, he’d retreated to the caves north of Wind, mumbling about soul cultures and sacred molds. I fear for him.”

Option.text: You want me to find him?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brendyl offers a tightly wrapped parchment.
“I’ve prepared a delivery scroll, bound by goatgut twine and dairy ink. You need only find Theodor Curdswain—the man bearing the trait of Cheese Maker—and hand him this message.”

“Do this, and the Artisan’s Circle of Frostmere will honor you with reputation... and perhaps a wheel of something pungent and delightful.”

Option.text: I’ll find this Cheese Maker for you.
Any clues to where he is now?
I must decline. Cheese is not my path.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brendyl sniffs the air as if following a scent.
“I once tracked his trail to a frozen waterfall near Wind. There were odd holes in the snow—round and faintly fragrant. His signs. But beware—Theodor was never the same after he invented the Lamenting Brie.”
He stares into the distance.
“You’ll know him by the smell. Like regret, aged 20 years.”

Option.text: I'll deliver your scroll to Theodor.
On second thought, this sounds insane.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brendyl nods solemnly.
“Blessings of the Buttered Saint be upon you. Find Theodor. Deliver the scroll. Let him know his cheeses are missed... and his return awaited.”

He bows, pressing the scroll into your hands.
